intro: Dioscoreophyllum triandrum, commonly known as the African arrowroot, is a climbing shrub native to tropical Africa. It belongs to the family Araceae and is characterized by its palmate leaves and showy, spadix-like inflorescences. The plant produces small, greenish-white flowers that are followed by red, fleshy berries. Its roots are used in traditional medicine for their purported health benefits. Dioscoreophyllum triandrum thrives in humid, shaded environments and is often found in forest understories.
